label: Description
value: Straight sided jar with projecting rim and domed lid Jar has 4 arch and pillar sections of fine diamonds which enclose 4 cut stars. Rim has fine diagonal blazes, 3 arches of fine diamonds, mushroom finial square-sided stem, square pedestal base.

label: Provenance
value: WGT Burne, LTD, 11 Elystan St, Chelsea, London, Sw3, purchased (5-31-72) by WPW.

label: Description
value: Everted double ogee bowl cut with flat flutes, blazes, a band of diamonds and a scalloped edge. Fluted stem with diamonds cut ring knop. Broad, circular domed foot has deep cut blazes in a swirl pattern. Pontil mark on bottom.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 22.2 x 12.7 cm (8 3/4 x 5 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Cecil Davis, LTD, London; 13 July 1972: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: One of set of seven bottles. Bottle has bulbous body with tapered, narrow neck ending in flat, circular pouring lip. Flat circular foot. Body encirlced with band of cut drapery swags filled in with vertical lines. Flat flutes on neck and below band. Stopper is stemmed button variety, flat with radial cutting.

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London, purchased (7-20-83) by WPW.

label: Description
value: Round body on short foot; lip turned-in and cut with fluting, sides cut with 6 panels of diamonds. Stand is shallow dish with wide lip cut with flutes, rayed flutes cut on bottom.

label: Provenance
value: W.G.T. Burne, London; 1974: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Round body on short foot, lip turned-in and cut with fluting, sides cut with 6 panels of diamonds; stand is shallow dish with wide lip cut with flutes, rayed flutes cut on bottom.

label: Provenance
value: LLoyd's Antiques, London; 1974: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Ovoid body, 3 triple neck rings everted lip; stopper mushroom-shaped with deep cut rays; pontil mark bottom.

label: Provenance
value: Rev. Cannon R.M.D. Westropp, Westermoreland, England; 1974 PW, NY (a gift)

label: Description
value: Shallow circular bowl; encircled star cut on bottom, narrow flutes rise to swags filled in with fine flutes. Trefoil cut rim. Well defined cuts.

label: Provenance
value: Delomosne and Son, LTD, London; 22 July 1975: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Shallow, circular bowl, encircled star cut on bottom, narrow flutes rise to swags filled in with fine flutes. Trefoil cut rim, well defined cuts.

label: Provenance
value: Delomosne and Son, LTD. London; 22 July 1975: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Ovoid body tapers to thin neck, wide flat lip with turned up rim. Hyacinth

label: Provenance
value: Shappard and Cooper Ltd., London; 1975 Phelps Warren NY

label: Description
value: Oviform body on splayed faceted foot, with flared lip and pouring spout; cut diamond band center, flat vertical facets above, twisted flutes below, scalloped lip rim; cut spiral fluting top of stopper.

label: Provenance
value: Christies; London (July 11, 1978, Lot 51, sale 1071); P. Warren NY

label: Description
value: Oviform body on splayed foot, with flared lip and pouring spout; cut diamond-band center, flat vertical facets above, twisted flutes below, scalloped lip rim; cut spiral fluting top of stopper.

label: Provenance
value: Christies, London (July 11, 1978, sale 1071, Lot 51); WPW, NY.

label: Description
value: Round bowl with a pouring lip, cut with vertical pillar flutes alternating with small diamonds, 2 prismatic bands below, a short round foot, ground pontil mark bottom.

label: Provenance
value: cf 1986-61-152, ewer, attributed to Waterford, same cut pattern.

label: Description
value: Round bowl with a pouring lip, cut with vertical pillar flutes, alternatingwith small diamonds, 2 prismatic bands below, a short round foot, ground pontil mark on bottom.

label: Description
value: Flat circular box each side slightly domed and shallowly cut with star pattern with hatching and cross-hatching in background, thin copper mount joining the 2 glass sides.

label: Provenance
value: Delomosne and Son, Ltd., London; 1980 Phelps Warren, NY

label: Description
value: Deep fluted-shaped bowl, short tapered stem, slightly domed 8-sided foot; lip scalloped with fan cutting, below that cut drapery swags with narrow vertical flutes above and wide flutes below, foot cut with facets at edges.

label: Provenance
value: Maureen Thompson, London; 1980 Phelps Warren, NY

label: Description
value: Deep flute-shaped bowl, short tapered stem, slightly domed 8-sided foot; lip scalloped with fan cutting, below that cut draping swags with narrow vertical flutes above and wider flutes below, foot cut with facets at edges

value: Maureen Thompson, London; 1980 Phelps Warren, NY

value: Deep flute-shaped bowl, short tapered stem, slightly domed 8-sided foot; lip scalloped with fan cutting, below that cut drapery swags with narrow vertical flutes above and wider flutes below, foot cut with facets at edges

label: Provenance
value: Maureen Thompson, London; 1980 Phelps Warren, NY

label: Description
value: Pear-shaped body cut with drapery swags and flat vertical fluting; flat circular foot; mushroom-shaped stopper with radial cutting. One of set of seven bottles.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 10.2 x 4.2 cm (4 x 1 5/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London; 1983 WPW

label: Description
value: Pear-shaped body cut with drapery swags and flat vertical fluting; flat circular foot; mushroom-shaped stopper cut with radial grooves. One of setof seven bottles.

label: Description
value: 6-footed scroll base, stem formed by 3 twisted dolphins; 3-sided shell- shaped body; twisted, cap-shaped top with pierced holes, surmounted by small spiral finial; painted in underglaze blue on white with dolphins on stem, man with violin on one side panel, floral and leaf motifs top section

label: Provenance
value: Purchased at Winter Antiques Exposition, NY, about 1955 by WPW

label: Description
value: Four-sided obelisk with molded shell and scroll ornaments at base of each side, finial at top, splayed foot; painted in underglaze blue, the sides with fruit and birds, the base with floral/leaf scrolls.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1958: J. A. Lloyd Hide, New York; ca. 1958: Walter Phelps Warren, New York; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall, twisted, fluted eight-sided vase with short flared foot and flaring mouth with shaped rim; painted in underglaze blue on white with eight vertical panels each with flower bottom, alternate mid-sections of landscapes or flowers, top section of flowers.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1957: James Cogar, Williamsburg, Va.; ca. 1957: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Shaped oval plaque with raised border; painted in underglaze blue on white with domestic scene of woman and child at spinning wheel, diaper and vine border; back unglazed.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1958: Elinor Merrell, NY; 1958: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Shaped plaque with raised molded border and circular ribbed hanging loop on top edge; painted in underglaze blue and yellow with leaf scroll border, chinoiserie scene center with figure in landscape.

label: Provenance
value: 1958: Walter Phelps Warren (from S. Berges, New York); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Eight-sided bulbous body on tall flaring base, tapering neck with bulbous knop and flared mouth; painted in underglaze blue on white, on the base with lambrequin border, on body with peacock, rocks, flowers, insects, lambrequin border, on neck and mouth with leaf borders and floral scrolls.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1959: S. Berges, New York;  1959: Walter Phelps Warren;  1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall reeded, eight-sided vase, straight-sided base swells to bulbous body, long thin neck, small bulbous section top, flaring mouth; painted in underglaze blue on white with overall floral pattern, lambrequin border bottom, leaf border top of bulbous body section.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1959: Duke of Leinster, Co. Kildare, Ireland; Louis Wine, Ltd, Dublin; 1959: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequest to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall, reeded, eight-sided vase, straight-sided base swells to bulbous body, long thin neck, bulbous section top, flaring mouth; painted in underglaze blue on white with overall floral pattern, lambrequin border base, leaf border top bulbous section of body.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1959: Duke of Leinster, Co. Kildare, Ireland; Louis Wine, Ltd, Dublin; 1959: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequest to Museum

label: Description
value: Ovoid body; short, straight-sided neck; painted in underglaze blue on white on sides with chinoiserie scenes of figures in pavillions and gardens, surrounded by 2 floral and scroll borders bottom, diaper and floral reserves above.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1959: Jacob Stodel Antiques, London; 1959: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum
